titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to preclude all corporations engaged in farm product processing with gross receipts in excess of $100,000,000 from using cash accounting.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 1/14/1987--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to deny the use of the cash method of accounting for all corporations engaged in farm product processing with gross receipts in excess of $100,000,000. (Present law allows corporations with gross receipts of $1,000,000 or less to use the cash method of accounting.)
